title: Bug 4964: Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter
description: While writing SWT code, the user types 'button.dispose'. The code assist list is up with two items: 'DISPOSED' and 'intWidgetdispose()voidWidget'. When the user types '(', the automatic code assist inserts the selected item from the list instead of 'dispose()' as desired.
OB: Build 204: The automatic code assist inserts 'DISPOSED' instead of 'dispose()' when the user types '(' after 'button.dispose'.
EB: Code assist should notice that the user typed '('. It should prioritize 'dispose()' as a better match instead of 'DISPOSED'. Alternatively, it should be case sensitive when automatically inserting code.
SR:
Build 204: To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the SWT code editor.
2. Type 'button.dispose'.
3. Without looking at the code assist list, type '('.
4. Observe that 'DISPOSED' is inserted instead of 'dispose()'.
